Ad Text:
Qscan Group is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging services, committed to delivering high-quality patient care.

About the Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Commercial Analyst to play a key role in delivering actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making across the Qscan Group. Reporting to the Business Insights Manager, you’ll leverage your analytical expertise to interpret complex business data, uncover performance drivers, and support strategic and operational initiatives that enhance commercial outcomes.

The position is offered on a permanent full-time basis and is located at our Clayfield Support Office.

In this role, you will:
Deliver insightful analysis on business performance across the Qscan Group to support strategic decisions and operational optimisation.
Design, build, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to stakeholder needs.
Present regular reports to senior leaders, highlighting KPIs, trends, and actionable insights.
Partner with business leaders to analyse variances, explain performance drivers, and recommend corrective actions.
Provide analytical support for strategic planning, including scenario modelling, investment evaluation, and business cases.
Contribute to data governance initiatives, maintain a data dictionary, and drive improvements in reporting quality and timeliness.
Identify, quantify, and address data quality issues affecting analysis and reporting.
About You
We’re looking for a proactive, analytical professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys turning complex data into meaningful business insights. You will bring:

A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics, or a related field.
5+ years’ experience in commercial analysis, business intelligence, or financial analytics.
Advanced proficiency in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a commercial mindset.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Desirable skills:

Experience with SQL, Python, or other data tools.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (e.g. Azure).
Knowledge of data modelling techniques (e.g. Star Schema, Data Vault).
What you'll love:

You will be supported to participate in personal and professional development. 
A Flexible Work Arrangements policy to help you achieve the ideal balance between work and personal responsibilities.
A range of employee benefits, such as paid parental leave, annual flu vaccinations and Fitness Passport. 
Access to our Social Club – including events, giveaways and monthly raffles.
At Qscan Group, you’ll be part of a team committed to excellence, innovation, and compassionate care. Ready to make an impact? Apply now and help us shape the future of diagnostic imaging in Australia!

Qscan Group encompasses Qscan Radiology Clinics, South East Radiology, North Coast Radiology, Alpenglow Radiology, Envision Medical Imaging and ClinRad. Together, we offer comprehensive diagnostic medical imaging services across Australia, utilising advanced technology and subspecialty trained radiologists to ensure the highest standards of care. Each entity within our network contributes uniquely to our mission of excellence, providing consistent, caring, and professional services.

Location: Parramatta (Hybrid)
Rate: $80–$100 per hour + super
Contract: 7–12 months with potential to extend
Are you an experienced finance professional who thrives in complex, fast-paced environments? We’re partnering with a NSW Government agency seeking a Senior Finance Business Partner to deliver high-level financial and business advisory services across a large and diverse portfolio.
In this role, you’ll work closely with senior executives and operational leaders to provide expert advice on budgeting, forecasting, performance analysis, and strategic financial planning. You’ll play a key part in shaping financial decision-making and ensuring strong governance, compliance, and reporting outcomes.

Key responsibilities
Provide strategic financial analysis, reporting, and insights to support executive decision-making.
Lead budgeting and forecasting cycles for assigned divisions, including labour analytics, capital planning, and variance reporting.
Prepare monthly management reports and dashboards, identifying trends, risks, and mitigation strategies.
Support the preparation of business cases, funding proposals, and savings initiatives.
Collaborate across divisions to strengthen financial performance, accountability, and process efficiency.
About you
Strong experience in financial management, reporting, and business partnering, ideally gained in large complex organisations.
Skilled in interpreting financial data and communicating insights to senior non-financial stakeholders.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines.
CA/CPA qualification.
Commercial acumen and/or experience gained within a Big 4 or large professional services environment will be highly regarded.
Why apply?
Join a high-performing government team delivering meaningful outcomes for NSW.
Competitive hourly rate and flexible hybrid work arrangements.
Opportunity to contribute to financial transformation projects within a large and diverse agency.
For questions please reach out via email to jpriebee@quayappointments.com.au

Category:
Other (Human Resources & Recruitment)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
At Ambulance Victoria (AV) we are proud to share our commitment to save and improve lives by providing outstanding care for our patients. This is our promise to every patient, and it sits at the heart of everything we do. No matter what corporate or support role you play in delivering our critical services to Victorians, you will join a team dedicated to bringing our vision to be a world leading ambulance service to life. 

We are seeking a Senior HR Analyst to provide strategic analytical support to enable data-driven workforce decisions. This role leads the development of reliable reporting frameworks, dashboards, and predictive models that translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior stakeholders. 

This is a Full Time, Permanent position. While WFH/Hybrid options are available, it is essential that the successful applicant maintains a presence at Doncaster in line with our hybrid working model. 

About the role

Reporting to the Senior Manager People Systems & Insights, responsibilities of this position include, but not limited to:

Lead and develop business requirements through advanced analysis and expertise
Design and implement data collection processes, establish data governance practices, and develop data cleansing and transformation procedures
Actively promote and contribute to AV's information management program through data quality and reference data maintenance
Serve as a senior contact point for data analysis requirements and foster strong relationships with senior managers
Apply expertise in data modelling and visualisation to develop insightful reports and dashboards 

About you

To be considered for this position you will possess:

A postgraduate degree or relevant industry certification (or progress toward) with high level relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of training and sound experience within a data related discipline
Proven significant experience as a data analyst or business data analyst, with a strong track record of working with large and complex data sets.
Expertise in distilling complex analyses into clear, compelling narratives and visualizations tailored for senior management and non-technical audiences
Advanced proficiency in Power BI, demonstrated by the ability to design, develop, and deploy sophisticated dashboards and reports that drive actionable insights and strategic decision-making
Experience preparing and presenting high-level reporting diagrams using Microsoft Visio, with the ability to effectively communicate complex processes and data flows to stakeholders in a professional and easily understandable manner 

Please see the position description for a full list of position requirements and key selection criteria. 

Working at Ambulance Victoria

As a valued member of AV you will enjoy a professional working environment that recognises the importance of work/life balance. We offer salary packaging options, generous personal leave entitlements, accrued days off for full time roles, and other benefits including free on-site parking. 

We believe our people are our greatest resource and the sustainability of our workforce depends on how well we utilise our people's skills and abilities and whether our staffing reflects the diversity of the Victorian community.  If you are ready to be an integral part in bringing our values of Care, Accountability, Respect and Excellence to life at AV, we want to hear from you! 

Important information

By applying for a position, you agree to undertake an assessment of any Secondary Employment or outside interests, in line with AV's Secondary Employment procedure. This is required to ensure there is no perceived or actual conflict of interest for AV should you be successful and commence in the role. 

Successful applicants will need to be willing to complete pre-employment screening including references, misconduct and Police Checks. 

This position is classified AV5 under the Ambulance Victoria (Management and Administrative Staff) Enterprise Agreement 2021. 

The position description can be found on the AV Careers website https://careers.ambulance.vic.gov.au. 

How to apply

Your application is an integral part of the selection process and should include

Cover letter outlining your experience and interest in the position
Current resume

When submitting your application you will be required to address the following:

Proven significant experience as a data analyst or business data analyst, with a strong track record of working with large and complex data sets. Expertise in distilling complex analyses into clear, compelling narratives and visualizations tailored for senior management and non-technical audiences
Advanced proficiency in Power BI, demonstrated by the ability to design, develop, and deploy sophisticated dashboards and reports that drive actionable insights and strategic decision-making
Deep knowledge of logical and physical data modelling concepts (both relational and dimensional)

Please note: Responses are limited to 500 words each and a separate document responding to each the key selection criteria is not required. 

Applications must be submitted by 11.59pm AEDT on Wednesday 26 November 2025.  Applications must be submitted via the AV Careers Centre website https://careers.ambulance.vic.gov.au to be considered. Emailed applications will not be accepted. 

For further information, please refer to ‘Applying for a position with Ambulance Victoria‘. For any further queries please contact recruitment via recruitment@ambulance.vic.gov.au or 03 9840 3653.

 

At all levels of our organisation a diverse and inclusive workforce allows us to deliver the Best Care to the Victorian community, and helps create a healthier, more productive workplace for our people. In the event you require a reasonable adjustment to support your application for this role, please contact us at recruitment@ambulance.vic.gov.au and a member of our Recruitment & Selection team will be in touch.

Our customer is seeking the services of a Technical Business Analyst

**This role is offered as a 6mth fixed term salaried opportunity**

**Can be based in either Syd or Melbourne**

**This role sits between the Business Analysts and the Developers. The role is to take the stories / functional Specs and put them into technical requirements developers can work from. Possibly could be called a Systems Analyst**

The Technical Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in delivering comprehensive analysis across complex and strategic initiatives. Sitting at the intersection of business operations, delivery, and technology, the role is responsible for gathering, analysing, and documenting requirements; designing scalable, value-focused technical solutions; and ensuring their effective implementation across cross-functional teams.

This role translates business goals into actionable requirements, business rules, process models, data sets, and success metrics. It ensures that solution designs align with strategic priorities, stakeholder needs, and operational realities. The position also identifies opportunities to improve processes, enhance service delivery, and drive the adoption of digital and data-driven products and services.

Additionally, the Technical Business Analyst provides leadership within the analysis discipline—championing best practices, mentoring peers, and ensuring that analytical outputs consistently meet organisational standards for quality, compliance, and value.


SELECTION CRITERIA
Key requirements include:

Demonstrated ability to deliver detailed business and technical analysis for complex enterprise solutions, ensuring alignment with organisational strategy.
Proven experience with enterprise platforms such as Dynamics 365 (D365), Power Platform, D365CE, Microsoft CRM, D365FinOps, D365FO.
Proficiency in requirements elicitation, process modelling, user story creation, and defining clear acceptance criteria.
Solid understanding of data modelling, system integration concepts, and API documentation standards.
Strong stakeholder engagement and facilitation skills to drive consensus and support cross-functional collaboration.
Experience working within Agile, Hybrid, and Waterfall delivery methodologies, including use of tools such as Azure DevOps, Jira, and Confluence.
In-depth awareness of security, privacy, and compliance considerations relevant to solution delivery and enterprise architecture.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with external partners and manage diverse stakeholder expectations in complex environments.
Proven track record in enhancing organisational performance by delivering solutions that improve business process efficiency, reduce technical debt, and enable scalable digital capabilities.
Strong leadership and collaboration skills, capable of guiding cross-functional teams, mentoring technical staff, and fostering shared ownership of architectural outcomes.
Highly developed communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence senior stakeholders, facilitate governance forums, and translate complex technical concepts into clear business language.
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving capabilities, adept at navigating ambiguity, evaluating solution options, and assessing risks across diverse technology environments.
Results-driven mindset, balancing innovation with delivery discipline to ensure solutions translate into measurable business value.
Sound understanding of security, privacy, compliance, and regulatory obligations, with the ability to embed these principles into solution designs and architectural decisions.
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure services and ecosystems (e.g., compute, storage, networking, identity, integration), applied within complex enterprise design contexts.
 
QUALIFICATIONS

Advanced business analysis skills, knowledgeable in BABOK and Agile BA frameworks.
Practical experience with process improvement methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma).
Experience in regulated sectors (e.g., financial services) advantageous.
Desirable Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Analysis, Information Systems, or related field.
5+ years of relevant business or technical analysis experience.
Certifications such as CBAP or Agile BA are desirable.
 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Analysis & Requirements
Stakeholder Engagement & Facilitation
Solution Design & Implementation Support
Process Improvement & Data Enablement
Business Data & Insights
Knowledge Management & Collaboration


**PLEASE APPLY FOR MORE INFO**

Company description:



At Komatsu Australia you'll be part of an inclusive culture where all our people thrive, reflected in our purpose: creating value together. We encourage people with diverse backgrounds to apply for this role.



Job description:

The Opportunity

As Komatsu's Data Governance Lead, you will design and implement the enterprise data governance framework, starting with Product Master Data.

You will drive the integration of Microsoft Purview and CluedIn MDM to create a unified, trusted, and AI-ready data environment which supports analytics, operational excellence, and innovation.

Working closely with business, IT, and analytics teams, you will embed governance policies, ensuring data is accurate and ethically managed.

This pivotal role establishes core principles for data quality, ownership, and stewardship while laying the groundwork for AI governance, aligning data management with Komatsu's strategic objectives.

Roster: Monday - Friday, 38 hours per week

Remuneration: $150,000 pa + 10% STI + Super

Komatsu benefits:

Families Policy: 16 weeks of paid primary carer parental leave, 4 weeks of secondary carer leave, plus many more family friendly benefits.
Financial: Income Protection Insurance provided through our company superannuation fund.
Career: Recognition, awards, flexibility, further education studies and internal career development.
Health: Corporate discount with Bupa, Total Wellbeing Solution with Telus Health.
Travel: Discounts with Avis, Qantas, Crown, IHG and travel agents.
Yearly Bonus: Potential to receive a yearly bonus.
Referral Program: $3000 referral payment for referring a successful new employee to Komatsu.

What we are looking for

Tertiary qualification in Information Management, Data Science, Business, or IT.
Practical experience in data governance, master data management, or data quality.
Familiarity with Microsoft Purview, CluedIn MDM, or similar data platforms.
Strong understanding of data governance principles (ownership, stewardship, lineage, metadata).
Effective communication and collaboration skills for technical and business stakeholders.
Proactive learner with a growth mindset, eager to mature enterprise data governance.
Resilient leader with the confidence to drive data quality and governance improvements.

Ready to get started? Simply hit the apply now button!

Komatsu offers a zero-harm culture in the workplace and competitive remuneration package. We employ people with different skills, abilities, cultural backgrounds, experiences, preferences, ethnicities and from different generations. Komatsu is committed to a workplace where women can thrive.

Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ( SQL / SSIS / Azure DF )
Initial 6 month contract (likely to extend)
Remote in Australia
$650-850 a day inc super DOE
Australia Citizenship required
  
Talent Insights is currently partnered with a government company who are looking to hire for a Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ( SQL / SSIS / Azure DF ) to assist in developing and managing their integration and reporting systems.
With expertise in data warehousing, business intelligence, and operational support, the Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ensures the delivery of sustainable data services that meet organizational needs and stakeholder requirements.
Working within a multi-disciplinary team, this role involves gathering user requirements, designing and developing data services, and ensuring high-quality delivery using modern technologies.
  
Primary Accountabilities for the Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ( SQL / SSIS / Azure DF ) include :

Service Delivery: Contribute to data integration, warehousing, and business intelligence functions in line with the team’s goals.
Advice: Provide guidance on operational and corporate data using modern integration and presentation tools.
Project Management: Lead strategic and operational projects, including developing data integration and warehousing frameworks.
Data Management: Support the development of data pipelines to integrate operational and corporate data for reporting and analysis.
Stakeholder Management: Maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to manage data governance and stewardship.
  
Key Challenges for the Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ( SQL / SSIS / Azure DF ) include :

Implement modern data tools to drive organizational change.
Build strong relationships to promote effective data management practices.
Navigate complex data systems in a dynamic environment.
  
Required Skills and Experience for the Senior Data Warehouse Engineer ( SQL / SSIS / Azure DF ) include :

Data Development: Experience with ETL tools (SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, AWS), SQL development, and data warehousing.
Analytical Skills: Ability to identify information requirements and plan data collection for integration.
Programming: Proficiency in languages such as Python, SQL, R, or Scala, and experience with distributed databases.
Operational Governance: Ability to ensure data and reporting products are consistent and reliable.
  
Qualifications:

Desirable: Tertiary qualifications in data science, computer science, or a related field.
  
Keywords: Data warehousing / SQL / ETL / SSIS / SSRS / SSAS / Microsoft Azure / Azure Data Factory / Data warehousing Engineer / Data Engineering

Job Title: Senior Commercial Analyst - GPC Asia Pacific
Ad Text:
At Genuine Parts Company, with nearly a century of expertise in the automotive and engineering industries across Australia and New Zealand, we take pride in nurturing a culture where our 6,000+ team members thrive. Our trusted brands stand for quality and reliability-and we genuinely care about our people, inspiring innovation and excellence every day.



The Role
We are seeking a Senior Commercial Analyst to partner closely with our Transport team, providing critical commercial insights that drive cost efficiency and operational success. Reporting to the General Manager Commercial, you will be instrumental in monthly reporting, forecasting, budgeting, and supporting key strategic projects, including a major Request for Proposal (RFP).


Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with transport operations to deliver actionable financial and commercial analysis.
Prepare and present monthly performance reports highlighting cost trends, variances, and recommendations.
Lead budgeting and forecasting activities, monitoring actuals and driving financial discipline.
Track and analyze transport initiatives to support continuous improvement.
Provide invaluable support for major RFP preparation, bid analysis.
Conduct ad hoc commercial analyses to influence strategic decisions.

What We're Looking For


Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Logistics, or related discipline (CPA/CA qualifications preferred).
Proven experience in commercial or financial analysis within transport, logistics, or supply chain.
Strong analytical skills with expertise in Excel and financial modeling; ERP or transport system experience a plus.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail and deadlines.
Experience supporting RFP processes highly regarded.

Why Genuine Parts Company?


Join a passionate, high-performing team that goes the extra mile.
Work in a supportive environment where your insights drive meaningful impact.
Be part of a company that values collaboration, innovation, and excellence.

Apply Today!
If you are ready to accelerate your career and work with a trusted leader in the automotive aftermarket and supply chain sector, we want to hear from you.

Challenger Limited is an ASX-listed investment management firm managing $123.9 billion in assets (as at 30 June 2025). Life with us is fast moving and always exciting. Together we’re driving to deliver our vision to provide our customers with financial security for a better retirement.

We achieve this goal by providing a work environment where people from diverse backgrounds, with a range of skills and experiences can contribute and succeed.

Join us as a Senior Financial Risk Manager  

An important role where you can drive strategic improvements and leave a lasting impact on our market and liquidity risk processes. 

Operating as a true financial risk partner and Market and Liquidity risk SME, you’ll work collaboratively with stakeholders across investment, credit risk, and actuarial teams on a range of projects and analyses. 

We work flexibly from our Sydney CBD Office where you can expect to work 3 days in the office and 2 days from home. 

We are open to considering applicants at both a Manager and Senior Manager level. 

About the role  

Our Financial Risk Team are a dedicated team of five professionals who oversee market and liquidity risk, the daily hedging process, and analyse exposures to various asset classes. The team collaborates with investment, credit, actuarial teams and management to manage financial risks and assists the CRO in defining financial risk appetite. 

As Senior Financial Risk Manager you’ll play a crucial role in identifying, assessing, and monitoring market and liquidity risks across our investment portfolios. You will work closely with senior management, portfolio managers, and other stakeholders to assess investment and risk management strategies that align with Challengers strategic objectives. 

Risk Modelling and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive risk analysis, implement modelling improvements, and ensure robust systems and processes. 

Risk Reporting and Monitoring: Prepare risk reporting and monitor portfolio risks. 

Business Partnering & Collaboration: You’ll collaborate and partner with portfolio managers and other key business stakeholders to evaluate new investment proposals and hedging strategies and provide meaningful risk insights and SME guidance. 

Stress Testing and Scenario Analysis: Participate in stress testing and scenario analysis to test our crisis management framework and ensure Challenger’s resilience. 

Projects and Continuous Improvement: Manage and refine risk processes, contribute to strategic projects across the Challenger Group and Challenger Life Company. 

Policy and Risk Committee Contributions: Prepare Risk Committee papers and policies, providing meaningful insights into financial risk. 

The skills you’ll need  

You’ll have demonstrably strong experience in the banking or asset management industry with a clear focus on market- and liquidity risk.   This will be coupled with a deep understanding of financial instruments, their valuation, hedging strategies, and risk modelling with a strong grasp of financial risk management concepts (market, credit, liquidity). 

You’ll need to have experience in identifying, assessing, evaluating, and managing market and liquidity risks with a track record of analysing complex problems and then developing and driving effective solutions. 

As well as; 

Proficiency in portfolio risk modelling and analytics, including Value-at-Risk, Expected Shortfall, stress testing, and liquidity ratios/projections. 

High-level user of Excel and other MS Office applications, intermediate SQL, Bloomberg, and risk management software. 

Relevant academic qualifications in a quantitative or financial discipline with a numerical or finance-related undergraduate degree. 

Post-graduate qualifications and certifications like GARP, PRM highly desirable 

Proven track record in investment management or trading would also be highly desirable. 

 
Additional Information 

At Challenger, we’re small enough to be agile, but big enough to accelerate bold ideas. We support your growth and development, offering flexibility and a culture that values your unique contributions. 

Competitive discretionary bonus scheme 

18 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents 

Challenger Day – one extra day off every year in recognition of the effort our people make.  

Additional support leave (fertility, gender affirmation) 

Extra superannuation contributions 

Employee share plan 

Employee Assistance Programme 

Subsidised on-site café and central location near Martin Place Metro 

Access to free onsite yoga, mindfulness and Pilates classes. 

Access to annual free flu shots. 

https://www.challenger.com.au/about-us/careers/our-benefits 

#LI-KM1 

#LI-Challenger 

#LI-Hybrid 

Challenger's employee value proposition guides how we work: Grow and realise your potential, supporting each other, stronger together and making things happen. Our culture encourages curiosity, considered thinking and meaningful contribution, with opportunities to build a broad and rewarding career.

We are committed to fostering a safe, inclusive and respectful workplace where people of all backgrounds, identities and ways of thinking can thrive, and promoting flexible working to support work-life balance. 

Challenger is proud to be a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, a Family Friendly Workplace and recognised as a Bronze Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI), the national benchmark for LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion.

Permanent

12/12/2025

Company: KARL STORZ Endoscopy Australia Pty Ltd
Ad Text:
Company description:



At KARL STORZ, we believe in not just creating jobs but building careers. As a family-run company, we understand the value of long-term relationships and actively work on promoting them.

When YOU grow, WE grow.



Job description:

Your Mission
Lead the finance related inputs to the annual budget and strategic planning process.
Responsible for timely and accurate submission of forecasts.
P&L management and support to the month end process, proactively managing business risks and opportunities.
Deliver management performance reporting packs, ensure reporting accuracy and deadlines are met.
Use of tools such as Excel and Tableau to build and automate business reporting, dashboards and drive analysis of customer and business performance.
Business Partnering with the sales and marketing team, providing analysis, financial leadership, and business case support to unlock growth opportunities.
Ability to deal with large volumes of customer data in generating analytics and insights.
Prepare and maintain sales incentive calculations, as per approved sales incentive plans.


Your Talents
Bachelor's degree, and professional accounting qualification (CPA / CA).
Minimum 5 years' experience in a similar role.
Experience with complex excel data models.
Advanced system skills (SAP, PowerPoint, Excel, BI tools - in particular Tableau).
Effectively communicates with key stakeholders of all levels.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Processes improvement mindset, resolve problems and implements solutions.
Effective time management, proven ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure.


We offer:

Your Benefits
Leave Benefits (Annual Leave, Personal Leave, Parental Leave, etc.)
Birthday Benefits
Transport Allowance (if applicable to role)
Onsite Parking
Accessibility to Public Transport
Flexible Work Arrangements
Wellness Programs and Activities
Professional Development Opportunities
Global Exposure & Business Travel Opportunities (if applicable to role)
All other statutory benefits

We are looking for a high-impact process improvement specialist who is able to lead and coordinate the adoption and integration of Microsoft Copilot across our client's wealth management practice. This is a 6-month full time contract position, with the opportunity for extension. We are also open to candidates on a day rate for this position.

Our client is a one of the largest banking and financial service businesses in Australia, who operate across all facets of banking and financial services. This position sits within their wealth management team which has approximately 200 staff. The wider business has gone through a major digital transformation and uplift with a focus on AI enablement and process improvement. This position is supporting the wealth management team's digital uplift.

You will identify use cases and opportunities for embedding automation into the wealth management team that is aligned with the strategy of the business - many use cases have been identified and must be delivered on. You will provide guidance, and recommendations on how to best tackle these initiatives.

Reporting to the Head of Transformation, there is a core user base of approximately 30 staff who you will be working closely with to get them familiar with the new tooling and change of process. Whilst this position is BAU focused it is also strategic, as tooling and process decisions will impact workflows and hiring decisions.

You will ideally understand banking and financial services (although this is not essential). It is essential that you have knowledge of process improvement using AI tooling (with a preference for Microsoft Copilot) and a passion for AI tooling and automation. An ability to manage change and digital transformation in teams is essential. You must have a tertiary qualification in business, technology or a related field - additional qualifications in AI will be highly advantageous.

If this position is taken on a full-time contract, there is a possibility that you will be involved in the roll out and training to the wider staff of 300. For more information please contact John Black on 0421 711 887 for a confidential discussion or apply through the portal to register your interest.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply please click apply or call John Black on 03 8628 2137 for a confidential discussion.

Aurec, and our consulting arm Chalfont, are currently recruiting for multiple Business Analysts roles, offering diverse career paths and impactful work across a range of projects. Each role offers the chance to work with leading organisations, contribute to high-impact projects, and grow your career in a supportive and forward-thinking environment. Whether you're seeking your next challenge as a contractor or looking to leverage your expertise in a consulting environment, we have opportunities to suit your ambitions.

What We're Looking For

We're seeking professionals who bring:

Proven experience in ERP, CRM, Service Design, WCAG
Experience with TechOne, Dynamics, Data skills, AI is highly desirable
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
A proactive mindset and commitment to excellence

Why Join Us?

Access to a wide range of opportunities across Aurec and Chalfont
Flexible work arrangements and supportive team culture
Career development and training pathways
Work with top-tier clients and cutting-edge projects

Ready to Explore Your Next Opportunity?

If you're ready to take the next step in your career, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out to our team to learn more about the roles available.

About Aurec

Aurec is a leading recruitment and workforce solutions provider, known for delivering exceptional talent across technology, government, and commercial sectors. With a strong national presence and deep industry networks, we connect professionals with meaningful roles that drive careers, innovation and growth.

About Chalfont Consulting

Chalfont is a digital consultancy driven by design and delivery excellence, a deep commitment to client care, and a culture that unites good humans to do great work. Our team possesses the full suite of capabilities to deliver exceptional business and technical services, from small improvement initiatives to significant transformations. Established in 2018, we leverage our local knowledge and tap into the global expertise to collaborate with you in achieving tangible and impactful outcomes.

Job Title: Senior Specialist, Advice Strategy and Business Operations
Ad Text:
About Us

We're all here to deliver great retirement outcomes for our members. We have a long history with the University sector and today we're a place where future-minded Australians can all come together. We have a track record of success and a culture focussed on being the best place to work in superannuation. We'll achieve this by bringing our values to life in everything we do - genuine care, being better together and a passion for outcomes. We have a clear plan of what we need to do and want you to help lead that journey.
UniSuper Advice is the Home for Advice Professionals. We provide members with trusted advice that supports confident financial decisions, through personal advice, digital solutions, education and strong partnerships with independent financial advisers. Our work is grounded in professionalism, collaboration, and better retirement outcomes for members.

The Opportunity

Step into a permanent, full-time role where you'll coordinate and execute strategic initiatives that shape the future of UniSuper's advice business. As a Senior Specialist, you'll play a pivotal role in bringing together diverse elements of the advice business, ensuring seamless reporting, business rhythms, and stakeholder engagement. In this role, you will:

Coordinate strategic planning, complex reporting, and business processes across the Advice Centre of Excellence.


Drive execution of strategic initiatives, supporting business case development, financial analysis, and funding proposals for new services.


Manage multiple projects and priorities, resolving delivery risks and ensuring smooth business operations.


Deliver industry research, market insights, and high-impact presentations that translate data into clear, actionable recommendations.


Build strong relationships and act as a strategic liaison across UniSuper, fostering effective communication, collaboration, and alignment.


Shape and monitor KPIs, dashboards, and business intelligence to track performance, adviser productivity, and impact.


Support business planning, governance, and leadership forums, including executive and board reporting, while championing continuous improvement.

About You

You're a natural coordinator and thrive in a fast-paced, outcome-focused environment. You bring:

Experience in financial services, ideally with exposure to superannuation, wealth management, or advice.


Strong business acumen, with the ability to understand business cases and financials.


Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills, including the ability to create compelling presentations and reports.


Proven multitasking ability, comfortable juggling multiple priorities and projects.


Adaptability, accountability, and a commitment to performance excellence.


Consulting experience or a background in strategic business management is highly regarded.

Why UniSuper?

At UniSuper, your work matters. You'll feel valued, enjoy a sense of contribution, and see how your expertise shapes better outcomes for members. We offer:

Additional leave days over Christmas and dedicated 'Community, Culture & Wellbeing' leave to support your personal and professional wellbeing.


$1,500 annually to invest in your growth, plus access to internal and external "lunch & learn" sessions with industry experts.


Exceptional parental leave to support employees in balancing their work and family responsibilities.


Be part of a diverse team where genuine care, collaboration, and continuous improvement are at the heart of everything we do.

We believe that the best way to achieve great things is when we come together and collaborate. Therefore, we ask you to be able to commit to 60% of your time in office.
At UniSuper, we celebrate diversity and inclusion, believing that varied perspectives are key to our success. If you're ready to grow your career and make a real impact, even if you don't meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply.

About Us

We're all here to deliver great retirement outcomes for our members. We have a long history with the University sector and today we're a place where future-minded Australians can all come together. We have a track record of success and a culture focussed on being the best place to work in superannuation. We'll achieve this by bringing our values to life in everything we do - genuine care, being better together and a passion for outcomes. We have a clear plan of what we need to do and want you to help lead that journey.

UniSuper Advice is the Home for Advice Professionals. We provide members with trusted advice that supports confident financial decisions, through personal advice, digital solutions, education and strong partnerships with independent financial advisers. Our work is grounded in professionalism, collaboration, and better retirement outcomes for members.

The Opportunity

Step into a permanent, full-time role where you'll shape the future of financial advice and investment products at UniSuper. As a Research Specialist, you'll be at the heart of our Advice Strategy, Research and Technical team, driving insights and innovation that empower confident financial decisions for our members.

You will:

Lead investment-related research, monitoring, and reporting for product lists and model portfolios.


Build and automate data dashboards and reporting processes, scaling insights across the business.


Manage relationships with external research houses and product providers, ensuring UniSuper's investment options are accurately represented.


Produce thought leadership and commentary for advisers, research houses, and internal stakeholders.


Collaborate with investment teams and key partners to deliver high-quality analysis and support.


Champion continuous improvement in tools and processes, enhancing the quality and impact of advice.

About You

You're passionate about making a difference and thrive in a collaborative, outcome-focused environment. You bring:


Experience in financial services, with exposure to investment products, superannuation, or financial advice.


Tertiary qualifications in finance, investments, actuarial science, mathematics, business, or law (FIAA or CFA designation highly regarded).


Proven ability to analyse complex data, automate reporting, and deliver actionable insights.


Experience building relationships with research houses, fund managers, and internal teams.


Adaptability, accountability, and a commitment to performance excellence.

Why UniSuper?

At UniSuper, your work matters. You'll feel valued, enjoy a sense of contribution, and see how your expertise shapes better outcomes for members. We offer:

Additional leave days over Christmas and dedicated 'Community, Culture & Wellbeing' leave to support your personal and professional wellbeing.


$1,500 annually to invest in your growth, plus access to internal and external "lunch & learn" sessions with industry experts.


Exceptional parental leave to support employees in balancing their work and family responsibilities.


Be part of a diverse team where genuine care, collaboration, and continuous improvement are at the heart of everything we do.

We believe that the best way to achieve great things is when we come together and collaborate. Therefore, we ask you to be able to commit to 60% of your time in office.

At Unisuper, we celebrate diversity and inclusion, believing that varied perspectives are key to our success. If you're ready to grow your career and make a real impact, even if you don't meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply.

The Company

We are partnering with a NDIS services provider who have recently acquired another organization and are in the process of integrating this business into their current systems.

The Role

As a Business Analyst, you'll play a key part in a high-profile contact centre transformation, helping the organisation enhance customer engagement and service delivery.

Responsibilities:

Support a contact centre uplift and customer engagement project
Focus on workforce allocation, scheduling, and process improvement as the business transitions to omnichannel capability
Work closely with project managers and stakeholders on surveying, data privacy, and pilot implementations
Blend of business analysis and light project coordination (approx. 50/50 split)

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst on process or systems projects focused on Customer Experience/Service
Strong stakeholder engagement and documentation skills
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple workstreams
Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and problem-solving capability

Apply Today

Submit your CV directly via email to Leah Townsend on Leah.Townsend@roberthalf.com.au or by pressing the Apply button.

By clicking 'apply', you give your express consent that Robert Half may use your personal information to process your job application and to contact you from time to time for future employment opportunities. For further information on how Robert Half processes your personal information and how to access and correct your information, please read the Robert Half privacy notice: https://www.roberthalf.com/au/en/privacy. Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

Synchro Partners is partnering with a leading organisation undergoing a major transformation and is looking for an experienced Payroll Business Analyst to join their ERP project.

The role revolves around working across payroll, HR, and finance functions, contributing to the design and delivery of a modern system solution.

Key Responsibilities:

Engage with stakeholders to understand business needs and translating them into clear system requirements.
Map current payroll processes and define future workflows to support system improvements.
Document functional and non-functional requirements that guide system design and configuration.
Create and validate payroll scenarios covering the full employee lifecycle, including onboarding, leave, superannuation, taxation, and offboarding.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure compliance with policies and legislative requirements.
Support testing activities, including developing UAT scripts and validating system functionality.
Partner with technical teams and vendors to ensure requirements are implemented accurately.
Participate in workshops, configuration reviews, and data migration planning.
Contribute to payroll interfaces and integration points with HR, finance, and time management systems.
Identify opportunities to improve payroll processes and system efficiency.
Assist with stakeholder communication, training materials, and user support to enable smooth adoption of the new system.
Key Requirements:

Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst in payroll or HRIS system projects.
Strong understanding of payroll operations, taxation, superannuation, and enterprise agreements.
Familiarity with payroll systems such as SAP SuccessFactors, Ascender, Chris21, Oracle HCM, or Workday.
Experience supporting testing and validating payroll systems.
  
This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a high-profile transformation program within a supportive, fast-paced team environment.
If you are looking for a new challenge and are looking to be a part of a growing and transforming organization, please apply within.

Synchro Partners by Slade Group are technology recruitment specialists. We help organizations gain competitive advantage by finding and securing exceptional technological talent.

We love partnering with clients to build high-performing teams – people who develop the best technology products, provide service excellence to their customers, and successfully deliver projects.

Our passion for people, technology, and commitment to being experts in our industry specializations is what sets us apart in the marketplace. 

For more information, please contact Bianca Rivera at brivera@synchropartners.com.au

Optus is an Australian telecommunications company, delivering more than 11 million services to our customers every day across mobile, broadband and digital solutions.

Optus is on a mission to transform business processes through data-driven insights and automation. As a Senior Process Mining Data Analyst, you'll play a key role in developing and deploying advanced Process Mining solutions that uncover inefficiencies and enable smarter decision-making. This is your opportunity to lead end-to-end projects, design impactful dashboards, and deliver measurable value across the organisation.

What You'll Do

Developing and refining Process Mining dashboards and solutions to boost efficiency and align with business goals.
Leading end-to-end projects, working with collaborators on data discovery and model creation.
Applying strong analytical skills to compose data models and interpret sophisticated process data for actionable insights.
Driving Agile project management rhythms to ensure timely delivery and alignment with the Process Intelligence framework.
Supervising and measuring the impact of implemented solutions, ensuring promised value is realised.

What You Bring

Demonstrable experience in data analysis and Process Mining, with strong SQL and PQL skills.
Capability to build and put into action dashboards that optimally communicate insights to collaborators.
Good project management capabilities, ideally within Agile environments.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Ability to engage and work with various collaborators to deliver impactful, data-driven solutions.

The good stuff….

Competitive remuneration and employee discounts. Make life easier (and more affordable) with $80 monthly credit and 25% off Optus products and unique shopping discounts with our retail partners.
Flexible working arrangements with opportunities to work three days in the office, two days remote or home.
Competitive leave policies, including additional 'Connected' days to focus on culture, family, health, community, or whatever's important to you.
We support growing families with inclusive, carer-neutral paid Parental Leave of up to 16 weeks.
Direct your own development and build future-ready skills with Optus U's industry-focused micro-credentials, developed with La Trobe and Macquarie Universities.
Build meaningful connections through employee-led networks and diversity initiatives including Culture Connect, Elevate Women, Disability Network and Express Yourself (LGBTQIA+).
Put your wellbeing first with free access to counselling and support services, 24/7 — in-person, by phone, SMS, or video.

At Optus, we are strengthened by others and that means valuing diversity and saying ‘yes' to embracing individual differences. We are committed to ensuring that our application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers, including individuals from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, individuals with a disability, individuals identifying as being part of the LGBTQIA+ community, individuals who may have served in the armed forces or who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. We also want to do our best to make our recruitment process inclusive. If you require any adjustments or accessibility support to participate fairly and equitably in the recruitment process, please email AccessibleRecruitment@optus.com.au or call 1800 309 170. We're here to help. When you contact us, please advise your preferred method of contact and we will be in touch within 48 hours.

For more information on Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging at Optus, please visit https://www.optus.com.au/about/inclusion-diversity

At ASIC, you can be the change that ensures a fair, strong and efficient financial system for the benefit of all Australians. Contribute to delivering on ASIC's purpose, vision, and strategic priorities to help maintain the integrity of the financial system and protect consumers from harm.

A Senior Analyst in the Strategic Intelligence team leads analysis to support ASIC leadership and teams to prioritise their areas of focus and undertake their activities. Your work contributes to ASIC's effective use of intelligence to inform its decision-making. You will also play a central role in developing and implementing ASIC's Intelligence Strategy.

Location - Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane or Canberra
Salary starting from $152,074 (depending on experience) plus 15.4% superannuation
Permanent role
Applications close at 11:59pm AEST Friday, 21 November 2025

 

The team 

Join ASIC's Strategic Intelligence (SI) team within the Registry & Intelligence group, where you'll produce actionable insights that shape organisational strategy and support confident participation in Australia's financial system. The team helps ASIC by providing economic and risk analysis, strategic data analysis and operational intelligence and leads ASIC's intelligence strategy. This role will contribute to the team's delivery of operational intelligence and implementing the Intelligence Strategy.

The role

As a Senior Analyst, you will:

Drive the development and implementation of ASIC's intelligence strategy and foster a strong intelligence culture.
Analyse diverse data sets to create clear, actionable insights and present findings in an engaging way.
Lead projects assessing strategic and emerging issues in regulated markets to inform ASIC's priorities.
Support people management within the SI team, promoting development and wellbeing.
Monitor regulated financial markets to identify key developments and risks to consumers and market integrity.
Collaborate with business, IT and analytics teams to design next-generation data-driven tools.
Work across ASIC on multi-disciplinary projects to deliver shared outcomes.
Strengthen the Registry & Intelligence group's influence and leadership across ASIC.

About you

In addition, you will have:

Postgraduate qualifications in a relevant field (e.g., intelligence analysis, finance, commerce) or equivalent senior-level experience.
Proven leadership in managing projects and mentoring teams within financial services, regulation, government or business.
Strong understanding of financial markets and regulatory implications.
Advanced qualitative and quantitative analysis skills, including data manipulation expertise.
Demonstrated project management capability with strong conceptual, analytical and resource allocation skills.
Excellent communication skills, with experience presenting complex information clearly to diverse audiences.

View the position description for more information or click ‘apply' to start your application. Applications close at 11:59pm AEST Friday, 21 November 2025.

 

About ASIC

ASIC's remit is one of the broadest of regulators across the world. ASIC regulates corporations, markets, financial services and consumer credit and monitors and promotes market integrity and consumer protection in the Australian financial system. Through our enforcement work, we hold to account those who contravene the law, working to achieve strong outcomes that address the greatest consumer and investor harms.

 

ASIC is committed to a providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. Indigenous Australians are encouraged to apply as well as applicants from all backgrounds and with different abilities.

 

We offer a range of employee benefits including:

Attractive superannuation
Additional leave entitlements
50/50 hybrid work-from home model
Flexible work arrangements
Assistance for study and professional development

 

Click here to view ASIC's salary and benefits guide.

To read more about ASIC, you can visit our website or review our Corporate Plan.

To work with us, you need to be an Australian Citizen and be prepared to complete an ASIC Suitability and Baseline Assessment.

AEMO at the Heart of Energy 

AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner. AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.    

About the role 

AEMO’s Corporate Strategy team shapes our organisational direction by developing a long-term vision, priorities and goals. We advise the Board, CEO and Executive Leadership on emerging strategic opportunities, challenges and trends, drawing on comprehensive energy industry analysis and organisational performance insights. Collaborating across all AEMO divisions, we provide a holistic, strategic perspective, enabling informed decision-making to best deliver on AEMO’s evolving role. The Strategy team also works closely across the organisation to translate our strategy into clear plans to deliver our vision and purpose. 

Reporting to the Group Manager Strategy, you will be working within a high-impact and tight-knit team, focused on analysing Australia’s energy systems and trends, assessing best practices from similar organisations, delivering insights to Board, Executive and Senior leadership, supporting the development of strategic priorities and guiding AEMO’s strategic planning process. Your contribution will be pivotal in shaping Australia’s energy future. 

What you will be doing 

In this role, you will leverage your strong foundations in energy industry and knowledge to analyse Australian energy system and market trends, undertake scenario planning and identify key implications to AEMO and the energy transition. 

Key accountabilities include:  

Undertake complex strategic analysis, developing and applying frameworks and tools.

Proactively monitor and evaluate local and international trends in the energy sector.

Develop actionable strategic insights and identify implications for AEMO, supporting the development and refinement of short to long-term strategic plans.

Track and prepare reports on the delivery of strategic initiatives across the organisation.

Monitor the key strategic performance indicators that tracks our performance against our long-term strategy 

What you will bring to the role 

We seek a critical and strategic thinker with strong foundations in the energy sector and a background in consulting, corporate strategy, energy operations or energy policy, ready to drive corporate strategy at a national level. 

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant business discipline (Engineering, Science, Economics, Commerce).

Strong foundations in a strategy-focused role, ideally gained within a leading consulting firm, corporate strategy function or a relevant energy industry context.

Superior analytical and modelling skills, with the ability to efficiency structure and undertake analysis with proficiency in using the tools available

Exceptional structured thinking and complex problem-solving skills, with an ability to strategically frame issues, and develop and rigorously test hypotheses

Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with experience working directly with senior management. 

In return some of our benefits to you 

Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options

Professional development via projects, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and more.

Give back with up to 4 days of volunteering leave per year.

Reward your hard work with annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility).

Embrace a healthier you with our wellness program, discounted health insurance, gym perks and our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program (EAP).  

About Our Process 

At AEMO we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome people of all backgrounds, including people with disabilities and neurodivergence and those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. If you have any accessibility requirements to support you during the application or interview process, simply let us know by emailing us at talent@aemo.com.au

Build and operate pricing models to meet business needs 

Broaden your career with one of largest General Insurer in Australia

Open to Sydney candidates only - Hybrid flexibility

About Hollard 

Hollard Insurance is part of the Hollard Group of Companies and a top 5 General Insurer in Australia and New Zealand. We underwrite a broad range of general insurance products, including motor, home, contents, business, bicycle and pet, in proud partnership with some of Australia's biggest consumer brands and broker businesses. As an independent and privately owned company, we believe we can go further together – for our people, customers, communities and partners – through an innovative approach to providing insurance. 

Our state-of-the-art facilities in North Sydney reflect our commitment to providing innovative workspaces that support hybrid and remote work. 

About the Role 

The Senior Pricing Analyst role supports the pricing of general insurance products using data analytics, statistical modelling, and in-depth knowledge of our products, customers, and partners to maintain a sustainable, profitable, growing business.

Key Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

Manage, interpret, and analyse internal and external data sources to establish prices for general insurance products.

Develop and maintain models utilising GLMs, machine learning, natural perils, geographic, and data science techniques.

Derive insights from models and analysis to recommend pricing and business actions to a variety of business units and stakeholders.

Implement pricing changes and quantify expected impacts on the portfolio.

Assist with management of customer complaints and remediation.

Assist with pricing team risk control management and reporting.

Provide analytical guidance and mentorship to junior analysts.

 About You 

4+ years of general insurance industry experience – pricing experience preferred.

Strong knowledge of the Australian general insurance industry and products.

Proven skills and experience with programming and data management languages such as SAS, SQL, Python, R

Proven skills in data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI

Proven capability in developing advanced general insurance pricing, statistical, and data science models.

Demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to a variety of audiences to enable effective understanding and decision making across the business.

Degree qualified in mathematics, actuarial studies, statistics, or similar quantitative disciplines.

Stakeholders' management expertise

 Working at Hollard 

At Hollard, you’ll discover an environment where you can truly make an impact. We offer the best of both worlds – the opportunity, agility and creativity of a company growing with scale, alongside a focus on becoming a catalyst for enduring, positive, social change. 

We’re a tight-knit team, where authentic voices and unique perspectives matter. We work supportively, collaboratively and inclusively to help shape our future and create shared value for our communities. 

Hollard proudly promotes flexible work including remote work, non-traditional work patterns, and work-family balance. We’re also unapologetically committed to creating a workplace that values your diversity with a true sense of inclusion.  We actively seek to hire for your different lived experiences, including as it relates to disability, ethnicity, faith, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, gender diversity, sexual orientation, age, neurodiversity. 

We’re building something special. Working closely with our industry partners to reshape insurance for the better, we’re people changing insurance. 

Please note:  

Even if you don’t meet all our selection criteria, we encourage you to apply.  

A full background check will be completed on the successful applicant. 

We will not require any support from Recruitment Agencies and kindly request that no unsolicited resumes are sent to Hollard in relation to this role or others. Only direct applications will be considered. 

Visit the Hollard careers page to learn about how Hollard will collect, store and handle your personal information.

We’re seeking an experienced Lead Data Engineer to drive delivery of a large-scale data migration and integration program within a major enterprise operating in the Financial-Services domain. The ideal candidate combines hands-on SQL and SSIS expertise with proven experience leading distributed delivery teams across onshore and offshore environments. This role will oversee the end-to-end migration of critical business and customer data as part of a platform transition initiative. You’ll coordinate activities across onshore and offshore teams, ensuring high-quality engineering outcomes while remaining technically hands-on in design, development, and testing. The position requires a mix of technical depth, leadership, and delivery discipline in a time-sensitive environment.

Key Responsibilities

Lead technical delivery for data migration and integration streams across onshore and offshore teams.

Design, build, and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines using SQL Server and SSIS.

Oversee development, testing, and deployment of stored procedures, data mappings, and transformation logic.

Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and code reviews to ensure quality and consistency.

Drive data validation, reconciliation, and performance tuning activities.

Partner with project management and testing functions to support dress rehearsals and production cutovers.

Maintain governance, documentation, and compliance with internal data standards and audit controls.

Skills & Experience

8+ years’ experience in data engineering, ETL, or data migration, with prior leadership responsibilities.

Expert knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL, stored procedures, indexing, and optimization).

Strong hands-on experience with SSIS for data migration, integration, and automation.

Proven track record delivering complex data migration or system consolidation projects in enterprise or financial-services environments.

Experience with data validation, reconciliation, and cutover readiness.

Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills across technical and business teams.

Bonus: exposure to modern cloud or data-engineering tools (Azure Data Factory, dbt, Redshift, or Python).

At Avanade, business and technology consulting isn't just your career…it's your passion. And that means more than just working with new innovations. It means using technology to solve business problems in ways that make a real difference to you and to your customer. At Avanade, our vision is to be the leading digital innovator, realizing results for our clients and their customers through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. What's important to us? Our values clearly articulate that we are agents of change, and we seek to make a genuine impact for our clients and their customers. We value diverse thought, perspectives and backgrounds. You play an integral role in shaping your team’s strategy and our future operations -
providing industry insights to evolve our Advisory services to ensuring our work provides a real impact on achieving organisational objectives, always taking into account business strategy, guiding principles and current realities

* Support engagement with government agencies and building strategic relationships with policymakers at all levels.
* Travel as required.You can translate strategic direction into operational goals in complex organisations. You can explain your insight into a business model to anyone, and you use your extensive experience in IT transformation strategy to give technical advice to senior executives.

Snowflake is about empowering enterprises to achieve their full potential — and people too. With a culture that’s all in on impact, innovation, and collaboration, Snowflake is the sweet spot for building big, moving fast, and taking technology — and careers — to the next level.

We are looking for a world-class technical Senior Solutions Architect to be part of a team that is responsible for the technical deployments of Snowflake to our customers. The Sr. SA will work directly with customers and with customer system integrators to deploy Snowflake. This person must be a self-starter and used to a fast-paced, fun, energetic environment and comfortable with dealing with ambiguity. This person must also have a passion to solve unique world-changing technology problems. The Sr. SAt will be responsible for providing the technical expertise to make Snowflake’s customers successful.

This person will have a broad range of skills and experience ranging from data architecture to ETL, security, performance analysis, analytics, etc. He/she will have the insight to make the connection between a customer’s specific business problems and Snowflake’s solution, the customer-facing skills to communicate that connection and vision to a wide variety of technical and executive audiences, and the technical skills to be able to not only build demos and execute proof-of-concepts but also to provide consultative assistance on architecture and implementation.

The person we’re looking for shares our passion about reinventing the data platform and thrives in the dynamic environment. That means having the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get done what needs to be done to make Snowflake and our customers successful. It means keeping up to date on the ever-evolving technologies for data and analytics in order to be an authoritative resource for Snowflake, System Integrators and customers. And it means working collaboratively with a broad range of people both inside and outside the company.

AS A SENIOR SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT AT SNOWFLAKE, YOU WILL:

May be named to several Snowflake customers

Lead technical pieces of client data warehouse implementations and on-boarding efforts

Work with the other Customer Engagement and Delivery matrix resources to ensure proper technical guidance, project management and functional support

Collaborate as needed with Product Management, Engineering, Sales, Sales Engineering, and Professional Services teams

Help clients troubleshoot the implementation of the product within their systems

Identify, document, triage and track issues to ensure resolution

Work with Product Management and Support as necessary when a scoped implementation or product feature cannot be implemented or does not meet the client’s needs

Play an active role contributing to the growth and scalability of the Customer Delivery and Training and Education teams through robust documentation, continuous process optimization, and capability cross-training

Apply industry/domain/technology expertise to client implementations

Gather intelligent product feedback and recommendations from customers to design and inform new features and capabilities

OUR IDEAL SOLUTION ARCHITECT WILL HAVE:

12+ years of experience in a customer facing technical role

Strong database and data warehouse experience, including recent experience writing and tuning complex SQL queries

Experience and understanding of large-scale infrastructure-as-a-service platforms (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, OpenStack)

Experience implementing ETL pipelines using custom and packaged tools

Experience using AWS services such as S3, Kinesis, Elastic MapReduce, Data Pipeline

Presence: enthusiastic and high energy, but also poised, confident and extremely professional

Innovative and assertive, with the ability to pick up new technologies and assess situations quickly

Exercises listening, takes time to truly understand client needs and address them

Track record of delivering results in a dynamic enterprise or start-up environment

Experience working cross functionally with teams such as Support and Engineering

Strong sense of ownership and high attention to detail

Creative and analytical problem-solving skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work on several projects simultaneously and meet stated quality objectives

BONUS POINTS FOR HAVING:

2+ years of practical Snowflake experience

OLAP Data modeling and data architecture experience

Hands-on experience with Python, Java or Scala.

Experience with non-relational platforms and tools for large-scale data processing (e.g. Hadoop, HBase)

Familiarity and experience with common BI and data exploration tools (e.g. MicroStrategy, Business Objects, Tableau); it is not expected you will be an expert with any integrated upstream or downstream tools used to access data in Snowflake

WHY JOIN OUR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TEAM AT SNOWFLAKE:

Unique opportunity to work on a truly disruptive software product

Get unique, hands-on experience with bleeding edge data warehouse technology

Develop, lead and execute an industry-changing initiative

Learn from the best! Join a dedicated, experienced team of professionals
